p: C. sappan extract had the highest antioxidant activity, with IC 50 values of 1.17 ± 0.06 mg/ml in 2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH) and 2.57 ± 0.16 mg/ml n 2,2-azino-bis(3-ethylbenzothiazo-line-6-sulfonic acid) diammonium salt (ABTS) and a reducing power of 334.78 ± 13.15 mM Fe 2+/g in the ferric-reducing antioxidant power (FRAP) assay (Table 1). P. emblica extract had the second strongest antioxidant activity against free radicals, with IC 50 values of 3.49 ± 0.17 mg/ml in DPPH and 4.95 ± 0.11 mg/ml in ABTS and a reducing power of 94.17 ± 0.62 mM Fe 2+/g sample in the FRAP assay.
